title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Fork before 5.8.3 allows XSS via navigation_title or title.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-13633
  • https://github.com/forkcms/forkcms/pull/3093
  • https://github.com/forkcms/forkcms/commit/b88f8a2033a4b9b4cbfce96c85691aafb021819d
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-74gc-hf33-5353
items.title: [forkcms/forkcms] Fork CMS Cross-site Scripting Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Centreon before 19.10.7 exposes Session IDs in server responses.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-10945
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/pull/8291
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/commit/02a3248602ce194fbb098af34be4652565db2468

  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/commit/afa0ee6d43d22860ae435163559912696569fc2f
  • https://github.com/centreon/centreon-archived/commit/fbee38536960eecaf52eda2bf31b90859c018b66
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200625084841/https://sysdream.com/news/lab/2020-05-13-cve-2020-10945-centreon-session-id-exposure/
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h5qv-p378-3hhr

items.content_html:
In Dolibarr 10.0.6, forms are protected with a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) token against CSRF attacks. The problem is any CSRF token in any user's session can be used in another user's session. CSRF tokens should not be valid in this situation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-11825
  • https://fatihhcelik.blogspot.com/2020/04/dolibarr-csrf.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m66x-wm27-xxpc
items.title: [dolibarr/dolibarr] Dolibarr Cross-Site Request Forgery Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. By abusing insufficient brute-forcing defenses in the token exchange protocol, an unauthenticated attacker could disrupt transactions between the Magento merchant and PayPal.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7928
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-hrg3-4q56-p2q5
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition DoS vulnerability

items.content_html:
A path disclosure vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. Requests for a specific file path could result in a redirect to the URL of the Magento admin panel, disclosing its location to potentially unauthorized parties.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7852
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220121011306/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-33
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xcgp-c6hp-cj4r
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Path Disclosure

items.content_html:
An access control bypass vulnerability exists in Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. An unauthenticated user can bypass access controls via REST API calls to assign themselves to an arbitrary company, thereby gaining read access to potentially confidental information.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7950
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-2fhr-f6q6-c4p2
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition Access Control Bypass

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the product comments field of Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. An authenticated user with privileges to the Return Product comments field can inject malicious javascript.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7944
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20220127030535/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-24
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3mxq-v9rw-m6x9
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the product comments field of Magento Open Source prior to 1.9.4.2, and Magento Commerce prior to 1.14.4.2, Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. An authenticated user with privileges to the Return Product comments field can inject malicious javascript.

items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin panel of Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This could be exploited by an authenticated user with privileges to store product attributes to inject malicious javascript.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2019-7937
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20211206084839/https://magento.com/security/patches/magento-2.3.2-2.2.9-and-2.1.18-security-update-13
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-94fc-rxhv-vvf8
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento 2 Community Edition XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
A stored cross-site scripting vulnerability exists in the admin panel of Magento 2.1 prior to 2.1.18, Magento 2.2 prior to 2.2.9, Magento 2.3 prior to 2.3.2. This could be exploited by an authenticated user with privileges to store product attributes to inject malicious javascript.

References
